business.headline: Gold and silver prices remain stable: Will prices gain after US Fed rate cut?Gold and silver prices steadied on Thursday after a choppy start, as investors weighed the impact of the US Federal Reserve's latest rate cut and awaited further clarity on global economic cues.

Cipla CEO Umang Vohra to exit in 2026; COO Achin Gupta named successorThe company said Achin Gupta, currently Cipla's Global Chief Operating Officer (COO), will take over as CEO and MD from April 1, 2026.

Novo Nordisk starts bidding war with Pfizer over US biotech MetseraNovo Nordisk bid up to $8.5 billion, including $6 billion upfront and later milestone payments. Pfizer's bid was worth $7.3 billion including milestones.
Sensex closes 593 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 592.67 points to close at 84,404.46, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 176.05 points to end at 25,877.85.

The sons in Tata Sons: A legacy forged in destiny by adoptionFor two centuries, the Tata name has symbolised Indian industry and philanthropy. But who exactly are Tata Sons? Who are the heirs to the empire founded by Jamsetji Tata? This is where the saga began.

Elon Musk's Starlink kicks off demo runs in Mumbai ahead of India launchDuring the trial, Starlink is expected to demonstrate how its technology can deliver fast and reliable internet, even in remote areas where traditional broadband services are often unavailable.

Groww IPO details out. Check price band, GMP, and important datesGroww IPO consists of a fresh issue of 10.60 crore shares worth Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 55.72 crore shares amounting to Rs 5,572.30 crore.

Lenskart solutions IPO opens on October 31: Should you subscribe or wait?The much-awaited initial public offering (IPO) of Lenskart Solutions will open for subscription on October 31. As India's leading eyewear brand hits the primary market, investors are weighing if now is the right time to take a position.

End of big workforces? What Amazon's mass layoff really signalsAmazon's mass layoffs aren't about cutting costs; they signal a shift in how work is organised. AI is taking over tasks, but the real battle is about how companies value people.

Why India's IPO boom isn't always a sign of growth. Explains expertIndia's IPO market may be buzzing with record fundraising and investor enthusiasm, yet experts say much of the money raised isn't going into new projects or job creation.

UPS to cut 48,000 jobs this year amid major turnaround pushShares of the Atlanta-based delivery giant rose more than 7% in afternoon trading on Tuesday after it reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue.

ITR deadline for audit cases extended till December 10. Who benefits and what nextTaxpayers requiring audit reports have got more time this year — the CBDT has extended the ITR filing due date to December 10, 2025.

Russian oil taps turned off. What it means for Indian refinersIndia's cheap Russian oil phase is fading as sanctions tighten. Refiners are shifting to costlier US and Middle Eastern grades, raising import costs and likely putting eventual pressure on fuel prices.

Sensex, Nifty fall despite US Fed rate cut; all eyes on Trump-Xi meetingThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 251.52 points to 84,745.61 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to 25,972.35. Broader market indices also edged lower in early trade, tracking a mix of caution and profit booking.

This Sebi proposal may benefit your mutual fund investmentIn its consultation paper released on Tuesday, Sebi said the goal is to ensure that investors benefit more directly from the growing size of India's mutual fund industry. Sebi has invited public comments on the proposal until November 17.

Gold, silver rate today: Has US Fed rate cut impacted precious metal prices?Spot gold was up 0.4% at $3,942.97 per ounce. However, US gold futures for December delivery slipped 1.1% to $3,955 per ounce, indicating some profit booking after the recent gains.

US Fed rate cut by 25 bps: How will it impact Sensex, Nifty today?According to early trends, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 26,188 points as of 7:45 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 26,053.9.

Gold and silver prices recover from recent lows. Is it time to buy?After slipping to three-week lows earlier this week, gold and silver have regained some shine ahead of the US Fed's policy decision. As markets anticipate a possible rate cut, traders are now weighing whether this rebound marks a good buying opportunity.

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to reach USD 5 trillion market valueThe milestone, reached just three months after Nvidia crossed USD 4 trillion, now surpasses the entire cryptocurrency market's value and equals nearly half of Europe's benchmark Stoxx 600 index.

Significant progress made in India-EU trade talks: Piyush Goyal after key meetsThe minister said that both sides are working towards a fair and reputable trade agreement, which will benefit businesses and consumers in India and the EU alike.

entertainment.headline: Baahubali The Epic mints Rs 10 crore, records biggest opening for re-release 'Baahubali: The Epic' set a new benchmark for Indian film re-releases by recording over Rs 10 crore in worldwide pre-sales on its opening day, marking the biggest re-release opening while previous overall records remain with 'Sanam Teri Kasam'.

Scream 7 trailer: Sidney Prescott returns to face chilling new Ghostface threat The trailer for Scream 7 reveals Sidney Prescott and Gale Weathers returning to confront a new Ghostface, with the killer's focus shifting to Sidney's daughter. The film, directed by Kevin Williamson, draws on the legacy of the nearly 30-year-old franchise and teases direct links to earlier entries.

Aaryan review: Vishnu Vishal stars in murder mystery that murders its own logicRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 Aaryan movie review: Director Praveen K's 'Aaryan' starring Vishnu Vishal, Selvaraghavan and Shraddha Srinath, is a murder mystery. While the film has an interesting premise, it falters in its execution and skewed justification for serial killings.

Billie Eilish calls out the rich, Mark Zuckerberg's reaction says it all At an event, Billie Eilish urged the wealthy to use their fortunes for good, drawing attention as she questioned extreme wealth – all while speaking in a room that included Mark Zuckerberg.

Baahubali producer Shobu Yarlagadda: AI a creative tool, control is with director Where does 'Baahubali' stand in the era of AI-generated mythological shows? Producer Shobu Yarlagadda exclusively talks to IndiaToday.in, as 'Baahubali: The Epic' releases.

Ikk Kudi review: Shehnaaz Gill lights up a film that fails to keep its glowRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 'Ikk Kudi' brings Shehnaaz Gill back to the big screen in a film that starts strong but loses steam. While the story has heart and humour, it struggles with uneven pacing and lazy writing. Her co-star Nirmal Rishi shines through the chaos, but even her brilliance can't rescue the wobbly ride.

Roi Roi Binale: Zubeen Garg's last film opens to sea of blind love Zubeen Garg's Roi Roi Binale is about love and a promise kept. Assam and the Assamese community is showing the world how to return love. As thousands watch the movie, releasing Friday, with welled-up eyes, it will be a final embrace, and a promise to an icon who shaped Assamese identity and revived a film industry single-handedly. Roi Roi Binale could be cathartic for grieving millions who loved him blindly

Jesse Eisenberg to donate his kidney to a stranger: I'm so excited to do it Oscar-nominated actor Jesse Eisenberg reveals plans to make an altruistic kidney donation to a stranger, aiming to help address the ongoing organ donor shortage in the United States.

Dies Irae review: Jump scares, genuine chills make Pranav Mohanlal's film a winnerRelease Date:Thu Oct 30, 2025 Dies Irae movie review: Director Rahul Sadasivan's 'Dies Irae', starring Pranav Mohanlal and Gibin Gopinath, is an immersive horror thriller that is intelligent and never takes the audience for granted. With top-notch making, 'Dies Irae' is a fitting addition to Rahul Sadasivan's filmography.

Baahubali The Epic review: SS Rajamouli's epic returns, this time without pausesRelease Date:Fri Oct 31, 2025 S.S. Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Epic' merges both parts into one reimagined saga, offering a nostalgic return to Mahishmati — but at a pace with barely a moment to breathe.

Manav Kaul: I do less work because I love acting so much - Exclusive Manav Kaul is all set to star in the upcoming film, 'Baramulla', which will soon premiere in the streaming space. Kaul opened up to India Today in a candid conversation.

Actor Bhasha Sumbli on acting's emotional toll: A part of you stays behind In an exclusive conversation with India Today, actor Bhasha Sumbli spoke about portraying strong emotional roles on screen. The actor stated how such roles takes a toll on one's mental being.

Bigg Boss 19 Episode 68: Pranit More leads captaincy task In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19', the captaincy task continued between Malti, Pranit, Shehbaz, and Gaurav. Given the support, Pranit led the task.

Rashmika Mandanna shares special video message amid Thamma success. Watch Actor Rashmika Mandanna shared a special video message amid 'Thamma' sucess and thanked her team for their continous support. The film released in theatres on October 21.

Gauahar Khan shares adorable new photo of son Farwaan. Seen yet? Actor Gauahar Khan has shared a new picture of her newborn son, Farwaan, two months after his birth. The announcement comes as Khan balances her return to work, fitness, and family life.

Zubeen Garg's final film 'Roi Roi Binale' sets record with early Assam shows Late singer-actor Zubeen Garg's final film 'Roi Roi Binale' is set to release on October 31, and theatres across Assam and several cities across India are preparing for a grand celebration right from dawn.

Rajamouli on Baahubali's re-release: Your love brought Mahishmati back SS Rajamouli recently visited Prasad Cinema in Hyderabad for the special screening of 'Baahubali: The Epic'. During the event, the director thanked the audience for their love.

Stranger Things 5 trailer: Millie Bobby Brown faces monsters in deadliest battle The trailer for 'Stranger Things Season 5' was recently released. The final season witnesses Eleven and Mike leading their team in fight against monsters.

Sweta Keswani: Priyanka Chopra only helping herself, not elevating South Asians In an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Sweta Keswani discussed how Priyanka Chopra is not helping elevate South Asians. She said that the global icon is only helping herself.

King Charles strips Andrew of royal titles over Epstein links, backs abuse survivorsKing Charles III has stripped Prince Andrew of all remaining royal titles, honours, and his Windsor residence amid renewed scrutiny over his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

American dream stolen: US highlights India in new ad on H-1B visa 'abuse'The US Labour Department released a new ad accusing companies of abusing the H-1B visa program, blaming foreign workers, especially from India, for taking American jobs.

His post appears more rhetorical than a real shift in US strategy.

Pak, Afghanistan agree to continue fragile truce, Taliban issues stern warningPakistan and Afghanistan agreed to uphold a fragile ceasefire after Istanbul peace talks brokered by Turkey and Qatar, even as the Taliban warned Islamabad against pushing its domestic conflicts into Afghan territory.

US deported 2,790 Indians in 2025, illegal crossings at 4-year low: CentreThe Indian government confirmed that 2,790 nationals were deported from the US in 2025 after verification. The announcement comes as illegal crossings by Indians into the US hit a four-year low.

BB19 producer denies minimum guarantee for contestants, breaks down casting processIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, 'Bigg Boss 19' producer Rishi Negi cleared the air about the minimum guarantee contracts for the contestants. The producer even spoke about the casting process.

For Gen Z, holding hand is a bigger deal than having sexDating apps, fear of being vulnerable, and the growing detachment between sex and emotion have made holding hands something Gen Z reserves for the special ones in their lives.

Live: NDA to unveil manifesto today, Chirag Paswan to hold mega rallyBihar Assembly Election 2025 Live Updates: With less than a week left for the highly anticipated Bihar assembly polls, all the parties have geared up their campaigns. NDA is expected to release their joint manifesto in Patna today. Several leaders of BJP, LJP and other allies will be holding mega rallies in the state. Meanwhile, Tej Pratap Yadav is set to hold a rally in Mahua. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

US changes work-permit rules overnight; students, spouses of H-1B holders to be hitThe Trump Administration has ended automatic extensions of certain Employment Authorisation Documents (EADs) from October 30, affecting H-4 visa holders, F-1 students on OPT, and asylum seekers. Applicants must now undergo fresh vetting to get their work permit renewed. The overnight change disproportionately impacts Indian workers.

This reimagined edition unites both parts into one grand saga, offering fans a nostalgic return to the kingdom of Mahishmati.

Tears, triumph and goosebumps: Jemimah breaks down after historic World Cup tonJemimah Rodrigues broke down in tears after helping India reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025 after beating Australia.

Caught on camera: Karnataka BJP leader's son slaps toll staff over free passA viral CCTV footage from Karnataka's Kannooli toll gate shows the son of a BJP leader allegedly assaulting toll staff over a free passage demand.

When smells make you sick: How nausea leads to a hidden thyroid disorderA woman's nausea triggered by food smells was traced to an overactive thyroid. This case study highlights how subtle symptoms can reveal serious health issues.

'6-7' named word of the year by Dictionary.com after viral TikTok crazeDictionary.com named "6-7" — a viral, nonsensical internet phrase — its Word of the Year, saying it reflects how digital culture reshapes language, even when no one really knows what it means.

35 minutes, 8 commandos: Inside Mumbai's dramatic studio hostage rescueThe operation was carried out in just 35 minutes. A Quick Reaction Team (QRT) of eight commandos barged into the audition room through a bathroom, a small entry point chosen to preserve surprise and prevent hostages from being exposed at the main entrance.

You sold a dream; how can you stop us? Indian-origin woman confronts JD VanceThe US Vice President was also asked by the woman about his Hindu wife and their 'inter-cultural' household in the face of the Trump administration's strict immigration policies.

sports.headline: Jemimah Rodrigues fearless yet selfless vs Australia: Wanted the win, not the fifty Women's World Cup: India's semi-final hero, Jemimah Rodrigues, emphasised that, through her fearless 127, she never thought about her own score rather just wanted to guide her side to the win from the get-go.

Amol Muzumdar: Never played for India, but one step away from winning World Cup Amol Muzumdar, the coach who never played for India, has guided the women's team to a World Cup final with his calm, Ted Lasso-inspired leadership and unwavering belief.

With friends like family, Jemimah Rodrigues wins battle against anxiety in World Cup Jemimah Rodrigues called her World Cup semi-final heroics against Australia a victory shared with her "friends like family." The Indian batter credited Smriti Mandhana and Radha Yadav for standing by her through anxiety and self-doubt.

I won't be there: Alyssa Healy drops retirement hint after World Cup semis loss Australian captain Alyssa Healy cut an emotional figure as she hinted that Thursday's semi-final against India might have been her final appearance in the 50-over World Cup, moments after her team's shock defeat at the D.Y. Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

She makes reels and runs: World Cup hero Jemimah silences prejudice with her bat India vs Australia: In Navi Mumbai on Thursday, Jemimah Rodrigues turned the Women's World Cup semi-final into her stage – crafting a century against Australia that silenced those who once dismissed her as a "reels and guitar queen," reminding everyone of the cricketer behind the charm.

Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues cries tears of joy in arms of parents after Australia heroics Jemimah Rodrigues broke down in tears of joy as she sank into her parents' arms after her unbeaten 127 powered India to a record 339-run chase against Australia in the Women's World Cup semi-final.

India's Miracle Chase! Women Maul Aussies In Record Run To Enter World Cup Final This special report covers the Indian women's cricket team's sensational victory over seven-time champions Australia to enter the World Cup final, focusing on key players Jemima Rodrigues and captain Harmanpreet Kaur. Rajdeep Sardesai called the performance, 'truly one of the great chases in world cricket'. In a stunning display, India achieved the highest-ever run chase in women's ODI history, successfully gunning down a mammoth target of 340. The victory was built on an unbeaten 127 by Jemima Rodrigues and a crucial 89 from Harmanpreet Kaur. The program features in-depth analysis from cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar and India Today's consulting editor Rajdeep Sardesai, breaking down the turning points of the match and what this win means for Indian cricket. India will now face South Africa in the final on Sunday.

Rohit, Gambhir join celebrations after India stun Australia in World Cup semis Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir and Sachin Tendulkar joined in on the celebrations as India defeated Australia to reach the final of the Women's World Cup 2025. India secured a record chase to set up the win in Navi Mumbai.

7-Months Pregnant, Delhi Cop Lifts 145kg To Win National Bronze This special report features the inspiring story of Delhi Police Constable Sonika Yadav, who won a bronze medal at the All India Police Weightlifting event in Andhra Pradesh while seven months pregnant. Sonika, who lifted a combined weight of 145 kilograms, said, 'I don't want pregnancy to be taken as a setback or something that stops women from doing something. It is normal and I wanted to set an example'. Serving in the force since 2014, she carefully balanced her rigorous training with medical supervision, with the full support of her family and the Delhi Police. Her remarkable achievement has sparked conversations about the possibilities for pregnant women in professional sports and has made her a symbol of strength and resilience, proving that motherhood and ambition can go hand in hand.

Credit to Jemimah: Harman proud after Rodrigues special ends Australia's reign Harmanpreet Kaur lauded Jemimah Rodrigues after the Indian batter scored 127 runs and helped India beat Australia by five wickets on Thursday to book their berth in the final where they will face Australia.

We are all crying with you: India doffs hat to Jemimah after World Cup special Jemimah Rodrigues scripted a fairytale comeback, smashing an unbeaten 127 to lead India to a record chase against Australia and seal a place in the Women's World Cup final. Fans and cricketers flooded social media hailing her match-winning heroics.

Martinez returns to Manchester United 1st team training after lengthy layoffLisandro Martinez has resumed full first-team training with Manchester United after recovering from a serious ACL injury suffered in February. The defender took part in a first-team session at Carrington, marking his first appearance since his surgery eight months ago.

Tanush Kotian credits Mumbai's experienced stars for improved showing for India ATanush Kotian reflects on his growth as an off-spinner through guidance from senior players and coaches, following a strong bowling display against South Africa A.

Rahul Dravid recalls mother's reaction to viral Indiranagar ka gunda advertisementRahul Dravid opened up about his viral 'Indiranagar ka gunda' advertisement and initial doubts. Dravid's bat-wielding, road-rage persona became a huge hit and the ad went viral on social media in 2021.

Litchfield hundred powers Australia to highest World Cup semi-final scoreAustralia posted the highest score in Women's World Cup semi-finals history on the back of Phoebe Litchfield's stunning hundred on Thursday, October 30. Australia posted 338 runs in 49.5 overs against India.

The franchise quipped on X that such a move is "not just difficult, but impossible," reaffirming their faith in the five-time title-winning star.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP.
